\chapter*{ABSTRACT}

\begin{singlespace}
\addcontentsline{toc}{chapter}{Abstract}

\noindent\Penulis. \NPM

\noindent\MakeUppercase{\Judul}. \\
Bachelor's Thesis, \Fakultas Department, Faculty of  \Jurusan, Gunadarma
University, \Tahun.

\noindent Key words : \KataKunci.

\medskip{}


\noindent (\JumlahHalamanDepan + \JumlahHalaman + appendix)

\bigskip{}

\end{singlespace}

\selectlanguage{american}%
Advancement of information technology has then affects people\textquoteright s
life and also the tourism field. As the center of the Indonesian capital,
DKI Jakarta has a wide range of tourist destinations and also a magnet
for tourists. Therefore, there needs to be the right decision for
the tourists who traveled in DKI Jakarta in determining the appropriate
travel destination based on the wishes of the tourists. The process
to select the destination to visit consist from many category and
criterion that then included in the Multiple Attribute Decision Making
(MADM) which then requires the presence of a Decision Support System.
The method used in the decision making for this research is using
the Analytical Hierarchy Process (AHP). 

This application was made \foreignlanguage{english}{by using HTML,
CSS, Javascript, Bootstrap CSS framework, MySQL and PHP} for tourists
in choosing tourist destinations located in DKI Jakarta based on the
type of category and various desired criterion. Based on the overall
likert scale score shows the average total score at 3.08 from 20 application
users and proves that the application is interesting in display, the
application functionality is useful and the application is easy to
use. 

\selectlanguage{english}%
\begin{singlespace}
\bigskip{}


\noindent Bibliography (\TahunPustaka)
\end{singlespace}

\chapter{INTRODUCTION}

\selectlanguage{american}%
\setcounter{page}{1}
\pagenumbering{arabic}

\selectlanguage{english}%

\section{Background}

\hspace{1.5em}The rapid advancement of information technology, especially
in the field of computer and communication technology or often called
as the era of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) bring
major changes to the pattern of community life in general. The increasing
development of Information and Technology make a considerable impact
in all aspects of life and bring people into the era of globalization,
which in this era human requires the latest information fast, practical,
efficient, and accurate and reliable.

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.7]{GlobalICT}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{\selectlanguage{american}%
Global ICT Development from 2001 - 2014\selectlanguage{english}%
}
\end{figure}


Figure 1.1 illustrates the use of Information Communication and Technology
(ICT) are increasingly experiencing growth from year to year \citep{itu}.
The development of ICT can not be separated with the development of
the Internet, because the concept of ICT itself is very closely linked
with the internet. The Internet has become an integral part of human
life in the 21st century. Advances in internet technology has become
a symbol of how to communicate freely, without constrained by space,
distance and time. Supported by various advantages and benefits of
the Internet, among other internet connection costs are relatively
affordable and unlimited availability of information, the Internet
is becoming one of the main needs of the community to meet all needs
related to information. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{wearesocial}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{World's Internet Users Data in September 2014}


\selectlanguage{american}%
\selectlanguage{english}%
\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.5]{statis}

\protect\caption{Internet Users in Indonesia from 2013 - 2014 and the Prediction for
Year 2015 - 2018}


\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{english}%
The development of the global Internet is growing rapidly, according
to data from wearesocial \citep{Simon:2012} on figure 1.2 described
that the world's total Internet users has reached nearly three billion
people. Indonesia as the country with the fourth largest population
in the world has a number of Internet users at 83.7 million users.
Internet users in Indonesia was itself continues to increase from
year to year, where in 2013 some 72.8 million users increased to 83.7
million users in 2014 and is predicted continue to increase to more
than 120 million users by 2018 as what depicted in figure 1.3\citep{statista}.
Therefore, the development of today's Internet is very important in
supporting a variety of community needs.

Along with the development of tourism, the Internet also took part
as the media and means of information for tourists in terms of finding
and determining the tourist destination that will be addressed. Very
abundant information about the destinations makes tourist experiencing
confusion in determining the sights that want to target in accordance
with the desired criteria. Various criterion such as the type of tourist
destinations, the cost, and the distance to be considered for tourists
in determining tourist destinations target which sometimes can not
be found on the internet. Internet in this case generally only displays
random sites and not well structured become the constraints for the
tourists in determining the appropriate destination.

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.8]{travel}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{Asia Pacific Travel Index}


\selectlanguage{american}%
\selectlanguage{english}%
\end{figure}


According to the data from the World Economic Forum in its report
entitled The Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report 2013 \citep{WEC},
described that Indonesia is ranked 12 in the Asia Pacific region in
terms of travel and tourism competitiveness in 2013 on the figure
1.4. This makes Indonesia is still far behind neighboring countries
such as Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand in terms of tourist competitiveness.
DKI Jakarta as the center of the capital of Indonesia, became one
of the main tourist destination points in Indonesia which is a concern
and ought to be developed to improve the competitiveness of Indonesian
tourism compared to other countries.

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.5]{visit1}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{\selectlanguage{american}%
Total Tourist Visit in DKI Jakarta from 2011 - 2014\selectlanguage{english}%
}


\selectlanguage{american}%
\selectlanguage{english}%
\end{figure}


DKI Jakarta Central Statistics Agency data based on the figure 1.5
explained \citep{bps}, the number of tourist arrivals (foreign tourists)
to Jakarta through three entrances (Soekarno-Hatta Airport, Tanjung
Priok, and Halim Perdana Kusuma) in October 2014 to reach 184,012
visits, an increase of 2.39 percent compared to visits by foreign
tourists in September 2014 which amounted to 179,723 visits. Conversely,
if compared with foreign tourists visit in the same month a year earlier,
the number of visits by foreign tourists in October 2014 was lower
by 7.10 percent. Ten nationalities become the most visitors to the
city of Jakarta for the month of October 2014 is Malaysia (24.687
visits); China (21.622 visits); Japan (17.234 visits); Singapore (14.712
visits); Saudi Arabia (7697 visits); South Korea (7159 visits); America
(6352 visits); India (5763 visits); Netherlands (5666 visits) and
Australia (5569 visits). Based on the above data, illustrated that
DKI Jakarta is very potential for the growth of tourists and become
a magnet destination due to DKI Jakarta as the center of the capital
and seat of government in Indonesia.

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.5]{touristvisitstay}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{\selectlanguage{american}%
Total Tourist Stay in DKI Jakarta in 2008 - 2013\selectlanguage{english}%
}


\selectlanguage{american}%
\selectlanguage{english}%
\end{figure}


There are various destinations in Jakarta, such as museums and monuments
destinations, shopping, entertainment, arts and culture, and others
approximately around 293 sights \citep{book}. Ilustrated from the
figure 1.6 that the length of time foreign tourists stay in star hotels
in Jakarta was 3.14 nights (2008); 2,96 night (2009); 2,60 night (2010);
3.15 the night (2011); 2,63 night (2012) and 2.44 night (2013), while
the length of time the local tourist stay in star hotels in Jakarta
was 1.93 nights (2008); 1.84 nights (2009); 1.92 nights (2010); 1.82
nights (2011); 1.84 nights (2012) and 1.85 nights (2013) \citep{bps2}.
Judging from the many tourist destinations and very least the average
time for foreign tourists and local tourists to stay and spend time
in Jakarta, the decision-making process in determining the proper
tourist destination and accordance with the desire of tourists is
required, so the time spent for the tourists can be more of time to
enjoy the various tourist destinations in Jakarta.

The ability of the decision making process fast, effective, and accountable
is the key to success in facing global competition in the future.
Having a lot of information is not enough, if not able mixes it quickly
become the best alternatives in the decision making process \citep{malcolm:2002}.
However, prior to the decision-making process from the various alternatives,
then there needs to be a criterion. Each criterion should be able
to answer an important question about how well an alternative that
can solve a problem faced by \citep{Saaty:1994}. One example of the
problems that are faced in making decisions on a variety of criterion
is the selection process to choose a tourist destinations. Many methods
can be used in the decision-making system. There are several categories
of models in decision support systems, one of which is a model for
optimization problems with alternatives in a relatively small number
\citep{Efraim:2005}. In the optimization model to problems with alternatives
in relatively small quantities, in which there are several methods
in MADM (Multi Attribute Decision Making), which consists from the
method of SAW (Simple Additive Weighting), WP (Weighted Product),
TOPSIS and AHP (Analytical Hierarchy Process). The method used in
this research is Analytical Hierarchy Process (AHP). The concept of
AHP method is to change the qualitative values (data cannot be measured
such as quality, comfort, cleanliness, etc.) into a quantitative value,
so that the decisions that made become very objective \citep{Saaty:1994}.
AHP is able to share the various problems that exist in the criteria
that can solve complex problems in this research, various tourist
destinations are divided into various criterion established in the
hierarchy to achieve a goal which is a goal to get the tourist destination
recommendation. From the above explanation, the qualitative data conversion
and distribution of criteria in support of this research, the appropriate
method to be used is by using AHP method. 

The rapid advancement of the ICT world and the increase of Internet
users in Indonesia, as well as to improve the competitiveness of tourism
in Indonesia make all these things are interrelated in the development
of tourism in Indonesia, particularly in DKI Jakarta capital. Therefore,
there needs an information portal formed as a website that can help
the tourists in determining tourist destinations. Because of that,
a web-based application is made to determine the category of tourist
destinations in DKI Jakarta that are tailored to the type of tourist
destinations based on the selected category on the selection of criteria
priorities, such as price, distance, transportation, and others. An
administrator is enabled to perform additional data for the tourist
destinations and edit the tourist destinations as well as make changes
to the weighting of the various tourist criterion, then that would
make this application can always be updated in accordance with the
relevant circumstances and with the existing renewal.

Based on the above background, the author conducted a research on
the basics that need to know to make the web-based decision support
system application. In this research the author analyze, design, and
develop a web based decision support system applications in choosing
tourist destinations in DKI Jakarta based on the background that has
been presented.


\section{Statement of Problem}

\hspace{1.5em}Problem of this research are:
\begin{enumerate}
\item How to determine the existing criteria, which the criteria assessment
will be used as a material consideration in the decision making to
assist the tourists in choosing the tourist destination in DKI Jakarta. 
\item How to design and create an application of decision support system
for the selection of tourist destination that are able to provide
the best decision along with tourist destination information with
the AHP method in accordance with the selection of criterion. 
\end{enumerate}

\section{Scope of the Research}

\hspace{1.5em}Problem discussed in this research has limitations
including the following:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Web-based system built using PHP and MySQL database by using AHP method. 
\item The data of tourist destinations were obtained from Jakarta City Government
Tourism Office include 10 categories of tourist destinations in DKI
Jakarta. 
\item Assessment of weight calculation with AHP method in this application
uses a dynamic system to the administrator to change the weight of
criteria for first matrix initialization and weight for each tourist
destination criterion. 
\item Weights and alternative assessment for initial matrix weight are based
on a questionnaire distributed at every sites in each of the category
to each of the 20 people in different places at random, irrespective
of age and gender and value for each tourist destination criterion
are based on the grading process. 
\end{enumerate}

\section{Research Objective}

\hspace{1.5em}The objective of this research is to make the Web Based
Application of Decision Support Systems in Choosing DKI Jakarta Tourist
Destinations with AHP Method. Test and analyze the use of AHP method
in making the website in choosing tourist destinations in DKI Jakarta.
The benefits of this application is made to facilitate the selection
and determining tourist destinations that exist in DKI Jakarta, help
the user to obtain information and introduce tourist destinations
in DKI Jakarta, and also able to help increase the number of tourists
to travel in DKI Jakarta.


\section{Research Method}

\hspace{1.5em}This research is conducted in following methods or
steps:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Collecting Data

\begin{enumerate}
\item At this stage, made a reference collection of documents necessary
to design and implement a decision support system.
\item Search for data and information related to Internet users in Indonesia,
the data of tourists visit in Indonesia and Jakarta as well as the
data of various tourist places in Jakarta. 
\item Conducting a survey by distributing questionnaires directly with the
tourists who are visiting several tourist destinations in Jakarta
to support the data in the development of methods that will be made
in this application.
\item Collect resources, which means finding a source that can be used in
developing this application. Searches conducted through the internet
with the content prioritize public license. This search is a search
for snippets of code that runs the application, as well as information
retrieval through interactive discussion with people who have been
experts in the development of this method.
\end{enumerate}
\item Requirements Analysis 


This stage will determine how to develop application, discussing the
problem that exist in the development of this application and analyze
AHP calculation process

\item Design


This step has a purpose to describe the application. This step is
undertaken with regards to the access right design, MySQL use for
data basis design and interface design of this website application
of decision support system by using Bootstrap CSS framework and mixed
with CSS. In order to ease the mean of application design, this research
is supported by Use Case Diagram and Activity Diagram.

\item Testing and Implementation


In the next stage in developing the application is implementing application
design that was created by using HTML, CSS, Javascript, Bootstrap
CSS framework, MySQL and PHP. After that, the final stage is to test
applications that aim to ensure optimal application can be run or
not by using the Black Box testing method, using scenario testing
to test the result and user acceptance test to determine whether the
application feasible or not to use. 

\end{enumerate}

\chapter{LITERATURE REVIEW}


\section{Tourism}

\hspace{1.5em}Etymologically \textquotedbl{}pariwisata\textquotedbl{}
is derived from the Sanskrit word consisting of two syllables of \textquotedbl{}pari\textquotedbl{}
which means many , many times, swirling , and complete , and \textquotedbl{}wisata\textquotedbl{}
which means a trip or traveling . Thus the notion of tourism said
it can be concluded as a journey who performed many times or circling
from one place to other 

According to \citet{Kodyat:1983} tourism is traveling from one place
to another, temporary, done individually or in groups, in an effort
to seek a balance or harmony and happiness with the environment in
social dimension, cultural, nature and science.

Furthermore, \citet{Burkart:1987} explains, tourism as a transformation
of people for a while and in a short term goal to a destination outside
the places where they normally live and work, and their activities
during the stay in that places. 

Terms of tourism is closely related to the notion of travel, it is
a change of residence while someone outside their home for a reason
and not to do something to generate wage. It can be said that the
tour is a journey undertaken by one or more people with the purpose,
among others, to get pleasure and satisfy the desire to know something. 

Tourists in tourism can be classified into 5 parts \citep{Smith:1998}:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Domestic tourism is tourism caused by people residing in a country
that has a tourist attractions inside the related country.
\item Inbound tourism is tourism as visits of people - those who not resident
in a state.
\item Outbound tourism is tourism as visits of the people from one country
to another country.
\item Internal tourism is a combination between domestic and outbound tourism. 
\item International tourism is a combination between inbound and outbound
tourism. 
\end{enumerate}
\hspace{1.5em}In Undang-Undang Nomor 10 Tahun 2009 Tentang Kepariwisataan
Bab 1 Ketentuan Umum Pasal 1 Ayat 6 \citep{UU:2009} stated : 
\begin{quote}
``Daerah tujuan pariwisata yang selanjutnya disebut Destinasi Pariwisata
adalah kawasan geografis yang berada dalam satu atau lebih wilayah
administratif yang di dalamnya terdapat daya tarik wisata, fasilitas
umum, fasilitas pariwisata, aksesibilitas, serta masyarakat yang saling
terkait dan melengkapi terwujudnya kepariwisataan''
\end{quote}
From the statement in the article of the law stated that a tourist
destionation is a place in which to have a tourist attraction, public
facilities, tourism facilities, accessibility (ease of transportation)
and their communities therein.


\subsection{Components of Tourism}

\hspace{1.5em}Tourism product is not a real product, this product
is a set of services that not only has aspects that are economical,
but also the nature of social, psychological and natural, although
the tourism product itself is largely influenced by the behavior of
the economy. Thus, the tourism product is a series of various inter-related
services, ie services produced by various companies (in economic terms)
in the form of transportation, lodging, eating and drinking services,
tour services and so on; suit a society and government (in terms of
social or psychological), among others, public utility infrastructure,
convenience, hospitality, customs, arts and culture, and so on; and
natural services include natural landscapes, mountains, beaches, natural
caves, marine parks and so on.

According to Medlik and Middleton \citep{Yoeti:1996}, which is defined
tourism industry results (product) is all services that takes tourists
since he departed leaving his place of residence, until he returned
to the house where he lived. Tourism product consists of various elements
and is an integral package, namely: 
\begin{enumerate}
\item Tourism objects contained in tourist destinations, which is the main
attraction of the people to come to visit the area.
\item Necessary facilities at the destination, such as hospitality accommodation,
bars and restaurants, entertainment and recreation.
\item Transportation connecting the country or region of origin of tourists
as well as transportation to the destination objects of tourism.
\end{enumerate}

\subsubsection{Object and Attractions}

\hspace{1.5em}Tourism products sold are equipped with elements of
benefit and satisfaction. Benefits and satisfaction was determined
by two factors, namely tourism resources and tourism services. Tourism
resources are also called atrrativ spontnee or tourist attraction.
Attraction or appeal is one of the important components in tourism.
Attractions is one of the core factors pull tourist movement towards
a tourist destinations, there are two (2) function of attractions,
namely as a stimulant and bait and tourism as one of the main products
of tourism and the main objective factors visitor arrivals. Attraction
or appeal available in tourist destinations intended for satisfaction,
and visitor\textquoteright s pleasure.

Attraction or appeal can be grouped into several groups depending
on the purpose, benefits, as well as the tourism planning. In Tourism
Planning, that the tourist attraction can be grouped into three (3)
classification, namely:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Based on Ownership


Available attractiveness owned and managed by three (3) sectors, namely
the government, NGOs, and private. The classification is based on
the attractiveness of ownership are classified into several types.

of local, more details can be seen in classification table of attractions

\item Based on length of stay


Tourist attraction can also be classified based on the length of stay
of tourists in the tourist destination. This classification is divided
into two (2) is touring and long stay.
