Table information :

\selectlanguage{american}%
GM = Good Medium (score 2)

UM = Ungood medium (score 1)

According to which it has been said that the calculation of the value
of the criterion attractiveness, tourism facilities, security, comfort,
remembrance, transportation and others done by calculating the maximum
value (total score). The calculation formula to calculate the total
score (maximum) for attractiveness, tourism facilities, security,
comfort, remembrance, transportation and others criterion and the
minimum score (minimum) for price and distance criteria as in the
examples below:

\begin{table}[H]
\protect\caption{Example Alternative Value}


\centering%
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|}
\hline 
{\small{}Alternative} & {\small{}Value}\tabularnewline
\hline 
\hline 
{\small{}X} & {\small{}1}\tabularnewline
\hline 
{\small{}Y} & {\small{}2}\tabularnewline
\hline 
{\small{}Z} & {\small{}3}\tabularnewline
\hline 
\end{tabular}

\end{table}


Then the total value calculation process for maximum (total score)
is:

$TotalValue(Max)=Max(1+2+3)=3$
\begin{equation}
Weightforalternative(Total/Max)=\frac{Alternative(Value)}{TotalValue(Max)}
\end{equation}


Then the total value calculation process for minimum (minimal score)
is:

$MinimumValue(Min)=Min(1+2+3)=1$

\begin{equation}
Weightforalternative(Min)=\frac{MinimumValue(Min)}{Alternative(Value)}
\end{equation}


Based on the above calculation process, there will be a division of
the value of each criterion from the total column of table 3.9 per
criteria. The results of calculations can be seen in table 3:10 below:

Based on calculations performed on the table 3.12, so for example
when the tourist choosing a category convention and exhibition attractiveness
criteria, it will produce output results the first rank is JI Exhibition
Center, followed by JI Expo Kemayoran, then the JCC, and the SICC.
Meanwhile, when tourist selecting criteria consisting from two criteria:
attractiveness (AT) and transportation (TR), it will be done the sum
of the values contained in the columns of AT and TR, so that would
be obtained the first order results of tourist destination recommendations
on convention and exhibition category is JI Exhibition Center as the
first result, followed by JI Expo Kemayoran, then the JCC and the
SICC. For calculation consisting one criteria and many other criteria,
performed the same process, by summing the values of the existing
criteria and sorted.

Distance calculation process used in this application is to calculate
the distance based on the haversine formula, which will take into
account two different points on the earth. For example, suppose the
tourist input the locations are in Depok on the application and want
to find a tourist destination with recreational category and price
criteria, it will be calculated in a straight line between the point
of longitude and latitude tourist in Depok with various recreational
tourist destinations in the application database. The shortest distance
of four recreational tourist destinations of Depok will be displayed
on the recommendation. Similarly, the process of calculating the price
of existing tourist destinations in this application, which will take
into account the price with a minimum value of a tourist destination
in accordance with the above calculation formula. In the other hand,
to calculate the price criteria it is will be calculated and for the
result will be displayed the cheapest price on the database irrespective
to the value, as long as the price is cheap (even close to zero price
or 1 Rupiah) it will be always determined as the best result for tourist.
Calculation process will be the same with doing the matrix pairwise
comparison for the price and distance criteria, same with matrix comparison
degree from attractiveness, tourism facilities, security, comfort,
remembrance, transportation and others criteria. 

The whole process of this calculation in the calculation of Each Tourist
Destination Matrix Weight Calculation applicable to the determination
of a tourist destination on the other categories and criteria chosen
by the tourists, by calculating the value of the top four destinations
to be displayed. The rank method in this application is done with
bubble sort method, where the concept of bubble sort that used in
this research is doing the sorting process based on weight value in
each tourist destination category that has been chosen with the criteria
which has been specified previously. Bubble sort was choosen because
it is the simple sorting algorithm that can use, and considering that
the data that will be sorted not have very big value and has been
grouped, so the sorting process will be done in fast and easy to be
implemented. Sorting done based on the highest weight value on attractiveness,
tourism facilities, security, comfort, remembrance, transportation
and others criteria and sorting with the minimum score (minimal) for
price and distance criteria. If found the same tourist destination
weight value, then the four tourist destination that will be displayed
will be sorted from the sequence that exist in the application database. 


\subsection{Application Design}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}In the third phase will discuss the application design.
In this stage the author will do the designing of web-based decision
support system based on data collection and analysis process needs
that have been done, it will be discussed the application design to
be made, among others:

\selectlanguage{american}%

\subsubsection{Process Design}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}The design process of this decision support system
application are using the Unified Modeling Language (UML). The design
process is presented in two diagrams, namely Use Case Diagram and
Activity Diagram. 


\subsubsection*{Use Case Diagram}

\hspace{1.5em}\foreignlanguage{american}{Use case diagram shows a
set of use cases, actors, and the relationships that occur between
the use cases and actors. Use case describes how the actors interact
with the system.The use case diagram that used in this website application
can be seen on figure 3.4 below. }

\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.5]{UseCaseDiagramFix}

\protect\caption{Use Case Diagram}
\end{figure}


Based on the above use case, illustrated that in this website application
there are 10 use cases to be run, in which case the actor tourist
can choose the category tourist destination, choose tourist destination
criteria then input location is extended from choose tourist destination
criteria, case view tourist destination recommendation then view tourist
destination recommendation detail is extended from case view tourist
destination recommendation. The <<extend>> depicts that a process
include from the use case process that becomes extend. For administrator
actor can perform all tourist or user cases and four other cases there
are add and change matrix initialization, add tourist destination,
edit and delete tourist destination tourist destination. The <<include>>
depicts that all process for admin is include for login process and
it is required an include process. 


\subsubsection*{Activity Diagram}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}\foreignlanguage{american}{Activity diagrams illustrate
the various streams of activity that occurs in the system, the starting
point of each flow, a decision that may occur, and the end of the
event flow. }
\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{enumerate}
\item \textbf{Tourist Avtivity Diagram }


Image of Tourist Activity Diagrams will be illustrated in figure 3.5.
Tourist activity diagram depicts the user interaction to interact
with the application to obtain the recommendation of tourist destinations. 


\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.45]{useractivity}

\protect\caption{Tourist or User Activity Diagram}
\end{figure}



At the Tourist or User Activity Diagrams illustrated that the tourist
or the user enter into this website application and then system show
the index page\textbf{. }When users perform activities \textquotedbl{}click
start button\textquotedbl{}, then the system would show tourist destination
category and criteria selection page. In this page, the user selects
the criteria and category for tourist destination and click the submit
button. The system will perform the calculation process will then
show tourist destination recommendation result page. Then the user
clicks tourist destination details where the system will then show
tourist destination detail page. Once completed, the user can determine
whether to repeat the process or exit the application and if the user
chose to repeat the process, it will be re-click the start button
and when finished, then the process stops.

\item \textbf{Admin Activity Diagram for Login Process}


Image of admin activit diagram for login process will be illustrated
in figure 3.6. Admin activity diagram for login process depicts the
admin interaction with the application to enter the system. 


\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.45]{adminloginactivity}

\protect\caption{Admin Activity Diagram for Login Process}


\end{figure}



On the admin activity diagram for login process illustrated that to
enter the system, an admin should go to the admin login page and then
the system will shows the admin login page. Admin then input the username
and password and then click login button. System then will verified
the account, if the admin account is valid then system will shows
the admin home page and then end the login process, and if the admin
account is invalid, so admin will be directed back to input the right
username and password. 

\item \textbf{Admin Activity Diagram for Matrix Initialization Process}


Image of administrator activity diagrams for initialization matrix
activity can be seen in figure 3.7. Admin activity diagram for matrix
initialization depicts how admin can perform a core process in the
form of additions or changes to the value at the beginning of the
initialization matrix. 


\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.45]{adminmatrix}

\protect\caption{Administrator Activity Diagram for Matrix Initialization}
\end{figure}



In the admin activity diagram for matrix initialization, an admin
have to do the login process as what depicted in figure 3.6. After
the login process successfully done, then system will shows the admin
home page. Admin will then click the admin initialization matrix which
then the system will show initialization matrix form. Admin will do
an add or edit initialization matrix, and after completion of this
process, the initialization matrix process is done. 

\item \textbf{Admin Activity Diagram for Add, Edit and Delete Tourist Destination
Data}


Image of admin activity diagram for add, edit and delete the tourist
destination data can be seen in figure 3.8. Admin activity diagram
for add, edit and delete depicts how admin can perform the addition,
editing and deleting process to the tourist destination data in this
website application. 


\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.45]{adminactionactivity}

\protect\caption{Admin Activity Diagram for Add, Edit and Delete Tourist Destination
Data}


\end{figure}



In the admin activity diagram for add, edit and delete the tourist
destination data, an admin have to pass the login process in the figure
3.6. After the login process has done, the system will then show the
admin home page. Admin then choose the menu, ``tambah data tempat'',
edit or delete the each tourist destination data. When admin chose
``tambah data tempat'' menu, system will shows the form tambah data
tempat, and then admin will input the new data, after that admin save
the data and then the addition process will end, when admin click
cancel, the system will be directed to the admin home page. In edit
process, when admin chose the edit menu, then system will show the
data and then admin do the activity to edit the data, admin then choose
to save the data and then system will save the data and the process
end, when admin click cancel, then the system will direct to the admin
home page. For the deletion process, admin choose to click delete
menu, then system will show the delete confirmation, if admin delete
the data then the system will end, if admin cancel the deletion process,
system will direct to the admin home page. 

\end{enumerate}

\subsection{Database Design}

\selectlanguage{english}%

required in the making of the application, the type of database used
is MySQL. In database applications, there are tourist destination
table and administrator table.

\subsection{Navigation Stucture}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Navigation structure of a website is used to describe
the outline of the contents of a web site that was developed and connects
between the contents of a web site are made. It embodies the navigation
structure of a composite navigation structure type. 

Navigation structure on a web application is started from the index
click ``mulai'' and enter the home page, then the user will perform
the selection process and criteria for the category of tourist destinations
and will get the results on a tourist destination results page, the
user can see the details of each of the recommended tourist destination,
other than that the user can access other menus such as menu ``tentang'',
and ``bantuan'' and ``daftar tempat''. As for an administrator
can access all the menu as the user, then the administrator can access
the ``login'' and ``logout'' menu, access the menu ``matriks
inisialisasi'', ``tambah data tempat'', view all tourist destination
data, edit data and delete data. 


\subsubsection{Tourist Navigation Structure}

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{usernavigation}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{Website Navigation Structure for Tourist}
\end{figure}


In figure 3.9 tourist navigation structure is described that from
the beginning of the index page, tourist will be entered into a website
application that able able to choose the criteria and desirable tourist
destination categories in Home page, but it can also access the menu
``tentang'' and ``bantuan''. After the tourists make the selection
of category and desired tourist destinations criteria, then the tourists
will go to the results page of tourist destination and also provided
``daftar tempat'' menu, and if tourists want to see more results
on the recommendation, the tourist will be taken to tourist destination
detail page. When tourist chose ``daftar tempat'' menu, then tourist
will go to the tourist destination palce lists page. In this application,
tourist can easily access all the page directly to each menu in all
page, due to this navigation is using the composite navigation structure
type. 


\subsubsection{Administrator Navigation Structure}

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{adminnavigation}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{Website Navigation Structure for Administrator}
\end{figure}


In figure 3.10 administrator navigation structure depicts that from
the index page, an admin can access all the menus ``admin'', ``hamalan
utama'', ``data tempat'', ``tambah data tempat'' and ``matriks
inisialisasi''. When administrator willing to see the tourist destination
data, then admin will be taken to the tourist destination table that
located in admin home page. Administrator doing the process to add
the tourist destination place, then an admin will be taken to a addition
form page for tourist destination. Therefore in ``tambah data tempat''
menu there is also menu ``edit'' to edit the tourist destination.
Meanwhile, when admin willing to change the initialization matrix,
then admin will be taken to ``matiks inisialisasi'' page. An admin
can visit application home page through ``halaman utama'', where
admin can visit all the pages same as a tourist to do the application
trial (figure 3.6) and can go back to the admin home page. In this
application, admin can easily access all the page directly to each
menu in all page, due to this navigation is using the composite navigation
structure type. 

\selectlanguage{american}%

\subsection{Interface Design}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}The design of the application interface is needed in
the process of making an application in order to facilitate the process
of making the application. This stage serves to adjust the layout
of text, images and key actions to be made, so that the applications
resulting display become more structured. At this stage, described
the interface design from Web Based Application of Decision Support
System in Choosing DKI Jakarta Tourist Destinations With AHP Method.
The interface design that will be explained is index page, start page,
tourist destination recommendation page and recommendation detail
page, help page, about page, list of tourist destination and also
administrator interface design that contained admin home page, first
matrix initialization page, add tourist destination page, and edit
tourist destination page. All the language in this application is
using Indonesian language to help the tourist understand how to use
thos website application application. 

\selectlanguage{american}%

\subsubsection{Front End Interface Design}


\subsubsection*{Index Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Index page page will display the first landing page
when tourist visit the website application. Index page can be seen
on figure 3.11 below. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{landing}

\protect\caption{Index Page Design}


\end{figure}


Index page design will be the first page when this application opened
and there is welcome greeting in this page. This index page equipped
with picture background about various tourist destination that exist
in DKI Jakarta to strengthen the application's theme. In this index
page, there is ``tentang'' menu to display the information from
the application's developer and information about the application
and also ``bantuan'' menu which will help the tourist to use this
application. In this page, there is ``mulai'' button for a tourist
to start the tourist destination searching process with this application. 


\subsubsection*{Start Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Start page design is the page when tourist click ``start''
button. This page is a start page for a tourist to start the application.
Start page design can be seen on figure 3.12 below. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{home}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{\selectlanguage{american}%
Start Page Interface Design\selectlanguage{english}%
}


\selectlanguage{american}%
\selectlanguage{english}%
\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{american}%
Figure 3.12 start page design depicts a page that consist of a logo
in the upper left coner of the page, then there is ``tentang'' menu
to display the information from the application's developer and the
information about the application, meanwhile ``bantuan'' menu which
will help the tourist to use this application. Furthermore, there
is ``daftar tempat'' menu to display all the tourist destination
lists that exist in DKI Jakarta. 

There is two input option that given to the tourist, tourist destination
category selection form and tourist destination criteria selection
form. For tourist destination category, tourist given the selection
with radio button to give the easiness to select one category with
behold directly to all category that exist, meanwhile for selection
on the criteria given the selection form with checkbox that ables
the tourist to choose one or many desirable tourist destination criterion.
Beside the criteria selection, there is a map and location search
input that used when tourist select distance criteria. The location
input field can be accessed and filled with tourist location after
the distance checkbox is selected, then tourist input the location
on the filed ``masukkan lokasi Anda'' and click ``cari lokasi''
button to select tourist destination at first. This map and location
search input given due to bridge tourist desire to find the tourist
recommendation location based on tourist's desire. Then, ``cari''
button that will process the user input, which after the processing
done user will be brought to the tourist destination result page based
on the previous category and criteria that has been selected. 


\subsubsection*{Result Page }

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Result page design will display the tourist destination
recommenadtion based on the category and criteria of tourist destination
that has been selected by tourist on the start page. Result page design
can be seen on figure 3.13 below. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{result}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{Result Page Design}
\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{american}%
In this result page, there will be displayed four tourist destination
recommendations based on the previous category and criteria selection
done by tourist. There is four name of tourist destination, each small
destination's photo and short description about the destination that
will be given to the tourist in this page, where each name result
can be clicked to see the detail from the selected tourist destination.
Under those four tourist destination recommendations, there is button
``pencarian ulang'' to do the reset search to determine the desirable
tourist destination, in this thing, tourist will be directed back
to the start page to do the reset search. 


\subsubsection*{Result Detail Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Result detail page will display the tourist destination
detail to explored further that previously displayed on the result
page. This page will display the detail from each tourist destination
that choses. Result detail page design can be seen on figure 3.14
below. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{detailresultnocomment}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{Result Detail Page Design}


\selectlanguage{american}%
\selectlanguage{english}%
\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{american}%
In result detail page will be displayed the tourist destination information
detail that has been selected by the tourist in previous result page.
There is a name and photo of the tourist destination. Beside the name
and photo, there is detail information about the tourist destination
such as category, address, region, price, contact, website and bried
description from each tourist destination. After that, under the photo,
there is located a map from each tourist destination. In the top of
the tourist destination name, there is ``kembali'' button to go
back to the tourist destination recommendation result page. 


\subsubsection{Back End Interface Design}


\subsubsection*{Login Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Login page is a page to enter into the system, where
this page can only be accessed by system administrator. Login page
design page can be seen on figure 3.15 below.

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%

\selectlanguage{english}%

Login Page Design\selectlanguage{english}%
}
\end{figure}


On the figure 3.15 login page design depicts the login form for an
admin before enter to the system, an admin should enter the correct
username and password to enter. There is button ``Back to Home''
is a button for an admin to go back to the application home page. 


\subsubsection*{Admin Home }

\hspace{1.5em}Admin home page design is a page when admin enter to
the system. Admin home page design can be seen on figure 3.16 below. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{adminhomefix}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{Admin Home Page Design}
\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{american}%
In figure 3:16 admin home page design illustrates that when an admin
enters the home page of the admin, then data will be displayed the
data of various tourist destinations that have been entered into the
application database. Where on this page, the admin can also edit
and delete process on each data from all existing tourist destinations.
In addition, at this admin home page design , admin can visit the
``halaman utama'', ``tambah data tempat'', ``matriks inisialisai''
and also ``logout'' to exit from the admin home page. 


\subsubsection*{First Matrix Initialization Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}First matrix initialization page design is a page for
an admin able to change the weight for each criteria as the initial
weight that will be used in this application. The first matrix initialization
page design can be seen on figure 3.17 below. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{matriksawal}

\protect\caption{Matrix Initialization Page Design}
\end{figure}


Figure 3.17 matrix initialization page design depicts the page for
an admin to do the process to change and initiate the initial matrix
value that will be used in the calculation process in determining
the weight for each criteria that exist in this application. Column
and row from this initial matrix consists from the name of all criteria
such as distance, price, attractiveness, tourism facilities, public
facility, security, comfort, remembrance, transportation and others.
Given the selection form to select the value between one to nine and
a half (1/2) to one per nine (1/9) to ease an admin in determining
and input the weight for each criteria. After the matrix initialization
process done, then admin press button ``update value'' to save the
weight value that then will be affects the matrix calculation in the
application. Will be displayed the value after the update process
in the table form of initial matrix, normal matrix and the final weight
for each criterion. This was given to illustrate the value from initial
matrix, normal matrix and final weight for each criterion, so the
admin could know the result from the renewal value. In this page,
admin can also access the other menu such as ``admin'', ``halaman
utama'', ``tambah data tempat'', ``matriks inisialisasi'' and
``logout'' on the page header. 


\subsubsection*{Add Tourist Destination Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Add tourist destination page is the page to add to
the tourist destination that is done by the system administrator.
Add tourist destination page design can be seen in figure 3.18 below. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{adddata}

\protect\caption{Add Tourist Destination Page Design}
\end{figure}


In figure 3.18 add tourist destination page design depicts the page
where an admin can perform the addition process for tourist destination.
An admin is required to fill the tourist destination data completely
in the form with required type because the tourist destination data
is fully required to be filled to support the completeness of information
from the tourist destination data. An admin should fill name form,
photo, address, region, latitude, longitude, category, price, contact
and website. For attractiveness, tourism facilities, security, public
facility, comfort, remembrance, transportation and others form were
considered to use the required type input form that only can be filled
with maximum five integer number that can be always compatible with
the renewal of tourist destination criteria value that obtained from
various method. After the input process has fully done, admin can
click ``submit'' button to save the date and also can click ``cancel''
button to cancel the addition process. In this page, admin can also
access the other menu such as ``admin'', ``halaman utama'', ``tambah
data tempat'', ``matriks inisialisasi'' and ``logout'' on the
page header. 


\subsubsection*{Edit Tourist Destination Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Edit tourist destination page is a page to make changes
to a tourist destination data that is only done by an administrator.
The design for edit tourist destination page can be seen in figure
3.19 below. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{editdata}

\protect\caption{Edit Tourist Destination Page Design}
\end{figure}


At 3.19 figure edit tourist destinationn page design depicts an admin
page to perform the editing process on one of tourist destinations
data that already exist in the database. In this page will display
the contents of previous data on each form field, such as pre-existing
photos and other data. After the editing process is completed, the
admin can press the \textquotedbl{}submit\textquotedbl{} to perform
storage and press \textquotedbl{}Cancel\textquotedbl{} to cancel the
editing process. In this same page, an admin can access other menus
such as \textquotedbl{}admin\textquotedbl{}, \textquotedbl{}halaman
utama\textquotedbl{}, \textquotedbl{}tambah data tempat\textquotedbl{},
\textquotedbl{}matriks inisialisasi\textquotedbl{} and \textquotedbl{}logout\textquotedbl{}
in the page header.


\subsubsection{Tourist Destination Lists Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Tourist destination lists page is a page that will
display all the list of tourist destinations in DKI Jakarta that exist
in this application. Tourist destination lists page design can be
seen in figure 3.20 below.

\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%

\selectlanguage{english}%

\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{american}%
On figure 3.20 tourist destination lists page design depicts a page
to show all tourist destinations that exist in DKI Jakarta that used
in this website application. The lists will be displayed and divided
in a table that divided tourist destination based on the six main
city region in DKI Jakarta: Jakarta Pusat, Jakarta Timur, Jakarta
Selatan, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta Utara and Kepulauan Seribu. In every
lists, tourist able to click and see the detail infomation on every
tourist destination. Tourist can also filter the tourist destination
list based on the category by click ``pilih kategori tempat wisata''
and will be shown all the name based on the filtered category. The
use of table form in this page is to give full list of tourist destination
that exist in DKI Jakarta, that then tourist will be easily select
the name of the destinations directly. 

\selectlanguage{english}%

about the criterion. 


\chapter{IMPLEMENTATION AND TESTING}

\selectlanguage{american}%

\section{Implementation}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}After doing the analysis and design phase of the application,
the next step is to implementing it into the web application using
PHP, MySQL for database management. In making this website application,
the Bootstrap CSS framework is used to design the interface for this
application. All the Bootstrap packages that will be used in this
application is implemented in all application's interface that will
be explained below. 

In this phase, the system applications design will be implemented
by using softwares that has been described. To know about the process
in the system applications, it can be seen in 4.1 interface implementation
table.

\subsection{Index Page}

\hspace{1.5em}Index Page is the first page that will appear when
tourist access the website application. Inside the index page display
the welcome greeting to the tourist and ``start'' button to start
using the application. Also located the navigation bar that consists
of ``tentang'', ``bantuan'' and ``daftar tempat'' menu. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
Index page of system application is shown in figure 4.1. In the index
page of the website application, given the opening website display
with various tourist destinations background to reinforce the impression
and theme from this website application. There is also a button to
start the application with contrast color button to ease tourist start
the application. 

\selectlanguage{english}%
\begin{figure}[H]
\selectlanguage{american}%
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{viewindex}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\protect\caption{Index Page}
\end{figure}


\selectlanguage{american}%

\subsection{Home Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Home Page is the main page from this application. This
page is the core page to start this application, where in this page
tourist have to select the tourist destination category and criteria
for the first time. One tourist destination category should be selected
first, and then tourist can select one or more tourist destination
criteria. Tourist also can input the location after choosing the distance
criteria. After the selection process has done, tourist can click
``cari'' button to see the tourist recommendation results. Also
located the navigation bar that consists of ``tentang'', ``bantuan''
and ``daftar tempat'' menu. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
Home page of system application is shown in figure 4.2 below. In home
page will be displayed for two selection process which was divided
into two steps to ease tourist in choosing the tourist destination
category at first and tourist destination criteria for the second
steps. There also a map that was given to locate the tourist location
after tourist select the distance criteria. The white background given
to ease tourist read all the text that displayed in this home page,
also there is a contrast color button to find the tourist destination
result after the selection process. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.48]{viewhome}

\protect\caption{Home Page}
\end{figure}



\subsection{Tourist Destination Result Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Tourist destination result page is the page after tourist
choose tourist destination category and criteria in the home page
and click ``cari'' button. In this application will display four
tourist destination recommendation will be given to the tourist. The
name of the result of tourist destination recommendations will be
equipped with each photo and short description for each destination
, tourist can select and see the detail for every name. Beside that,
under the result, there is located ``pencarian ulang'' button to
reset search the tourist destination recommendation. Also located
the navigation bar that consists of ``tentang'', ``bantuan'' and
``daftar tempat'' menu. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
Code snippets of the tourist destination result page are follows: 

\lstinputlisting[caption=Tourist Destination Result, style=php] {resultcoding.php}

The results of the snippet code above can be seen in figure 4.3 below.
The tourist destinations result page consists of white color background
to make the figure and text can be seen clearly. The blue color font
on the tourist destinations result given to clarify the result and
make the tourist easy to read the text. There is also an information
based on the previous category and criteria selection to remind what
tourist have selected before. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.5]{resultview}

\protect\caption{Tourist Destination Result Page}
\end{figure}



\subsection{Tourist Destination Detail Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Tourist destination detail page is a page after tourist
got the tourist destination recommendation result and click on the
name that displayed as the result. In this page, will be described
about the tourist recommendation name and photo. There is located
description box that is consist from tourist destination name, category,
address, region, price, contact, website and brief description. Under
the description box, tourist destination map is displayed to help
the tourist know the exact location from the tourist destination directly.
``Kembali'' button provided to facilitate the tourist to see the
other tourist recommendation detail with visiting back to the tourist
recommendation result page again. Also located the navigation bar
that consists of ``tentang'', ``bantuan'' and ``daftar tempat''
menu. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
Code snippets of the tourist destination detail page are follows: 

\lstinputlisting[caption=Tourist Destination Detail, style=php] {detailbab4.php}

Tourist destination detail page of system application is shown in
figure 4.4 below. In tourist destination detail page displayed big
tourist destination name to ease tourist know the name clearly, tourist
destination photo and map was also given to depict each tourist destination
clearly. The tourist destination profile was given in a box to ease
tourist read the information neatly and clearly. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{touristdestinationview}

\protect\caption{Tourist Destination Detail Page}
\end{figure}



\subsection{Tourist Destination List }

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Tourist destination list page is a page to display
all the tourist destination that located in DKI Jakarta. In this page,
all the tourist destination will be divided based on six region in
DKI Jakarta: Central Jakarta, East Jakarta, South Jakarta, West Jakarta,
North Jakarta and Kepulauan Seribu. In each region, tourist destination
will be divided based on each category: \foreignlanguage{american}{Museum
and Landmark, Recreation, Shopping, Art, Culinary, Kepulauan Seribu,
Theatre, Entertainment, Golf and Spa and Convention and Exhibition}.
Tourist destination list was made to accomodate tourist to see all
the tourist destination entirely and could see the detail of each
destination. ``Kembali'' button given for tourist to go back to
the previous page before this page. Also located the navigation bar
that consists of ``tentang'', ``bantuan'' and ``daftar tempat''
menu. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
Code snippets of the tourist destination list page are follows: 

\lstinputlisting[caption=Tourist Destination List, style=php]{daftarbab4.php}

Tourist destination list page of system application is shown in figure
4.5 below. In tourist destination list page displayed all the tourist
destinations in DKI Jakarta that divided into six region in DKI Jakarta.
The blue color for tourist destination name was given to ease tourist
read the each name. There is also the blue filtration drop down color
button to ease tourist to filter the tourist destination category
in each region in DKI Jakarta easily. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{listplace}

\protect\caption{Tourist Destination List}
\end{figure}

the administrator must input the correct username and password to
log into the system applications. System will verify the username
and password, if username and password are correct, system will redirect
administrator into admin home page. }

\subsection{Admin Home Page}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Admin home page is the main page for an admin after
admin successfully enter the system application. In admin home page
will be displayed the table of all tourist destination that exist
in application database as the main page for admin home page. Admin
can conducting all the process of edit, delete, add destination, access
the ``matrix inisialisasi'' menu, visiting the home page to run
the application like the usual user (tourist) and also can log out
from the system. 

\selectlanguage{american}%

\end{figure}



\subsection{Add Tourist Destination }

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Add tourist destination or ``tambah data tempat''
is a page for admin to add the new tourist destination in DKI Jakarta
to be inserted to the application database. \foreignlanguage{american}{In
this page an admin should fill name form, input the photo file, address,
region, latitude, longitude, category, price, contact, website, attractiveness,
tourism facilities, security, public facility, comfort, remembrance,
transportation and others. These all fields are required type form
to ensure the completeness of information from the tourist destination
to be displayed in the application. After the input process has fully
done, admin can click ``submit'' button to save the date and also
can click ``cancel'' button to cancel the addition process.}

\selectlanguage{american}%
Code snippets of the add tourist destination page are follows: 

\lstinputlisting [caption=Add Tourist Destination, style=php]{dataproses.php}

4.8 below.

\protect\caption{Add Tourist Destination}
\end{figure}



\subsection{Edit Tourist Destination}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Edit tourist destination page is a to edit the tourist
destination data that has already exist and inserted before. The data
that exist in each form in this page is taken from the previous chosen
tourist destination clicked by ad admin to do the editing process.
In this edit tourist destination page, an admin should fill all the
field before saving the data. After finish to edit the data, admin
then click ``simpan'' button to save the data that has been edited,
meanwhile admin can click ``cancel'' button to cancel the editing
process. 

\selectlanguage{american}%

\protect\caption{Edit Tourist Destination Page}
\end{figure}



\subsection{Initialization Matrix }

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Initialization matrix is a page for an admin to change
the weight value from beginning tourist destination criteria. An admin
just have to select each value of the criteria in this page and the
selection form is using drop down selection form filled with number
form one to nine and a half to one per nine to ease an admin in the
grading process in this matrix initialization process. The score that
given in this page will be directly affects the initial weight for
each criteria in the first initialization matrix which will then be
calculated by multiplying the value of the initial weight with weight
of each criterion owned by each tourist destination.After the initialization
process has done, admin click ``update value'' button to update
the weight. This weighting process is based on AHP method and in this
page also a brief description how to choose a number value that exist
on the selection form. 

\selectlanguage{american}%
Code snippets of the initialization matrix page are follows: 

\lstinputlisting [caption=Initialization Matrix, style=php]{coba_ahp1.php}

Initialization matrix page of system application is shown in figure
4.10 below. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{initialmatrixview}

\protect\caption{Initialization Matrix}
\end{figure}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Help or ``bantuan'' page is a page that contains
the brief steps to use this application that framed into one in a
form of short paragraph description in a button to avoid the tourist
read long description to use this website application then. Beside
that, in this page also displayed the short explanation about the
criteria that used in the selection process to make tourist understand
the criteria that used, and this explanation presented in a button
form and tourist have to click the button first to see the explanation
due to avoid the tourist read long description in this page.

\section{Testing}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}\foreignlanguage{american}{The testing phase is done
after the implementation is complete. Tests carried out using black
box method that divided in three stages, namely: }
\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{enumerate}
\item Application testing with scenario testing.
\item Application testing with functionality testing. 
\item User acceptance testing performed by respondents. 
\end{enumerate}

\subsection{Scenario Testing}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Scenario testing was conducted to test the result that
will be given as an output for the tourist as a tourist recommendation.
The scenario testing was conducted for one criteria, two criterion,
and three criterion in various tourist destination category. The scenario
testing as follows: 
\selectlanguage{american}%
\begin{enumerate}
\item Testing on one criteria 


This testing is done by conducting selection for one criteria:
\begin{enumerate}
\item First example in this example is selecting the attractiveness criteria
in recreation category. Here is the testing result from attractiveness
criterita in recreation category that can be seen on the figure 4.13
below. 
\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{scenario1}

\protect\caption{Scenario testing on attractiveness criteria in recreation category}
\end{figure}

\item Second example in this example is selecting the distance criteria
in culinary category. Here is the testing result from distance criteria
(from Depok) in culinary category that can be seen on the figure 4.14
below.


\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{scenario1b}

\protect\caption{Scenario testing on distance criteria in culinary category}


\end{figure}


\end{enumerate}

The scenario testing for one criteria is also conducted for each combination
of the criteria and category with manual calculation and using the
application and obtained the corresponding results from all scenario
testing. 

\item Testing on two criterion


This testing is done by conducting selection for two criterion: 
\begin{enumerate}
\item First example is selecting the price and transportation criteria in
golf and spa category. Here is the testing result from price and transportation
criteria in golf and spa category that can be seen on the figure 4.15
below.


\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{scenario2a}

\protect\caption{Scenario testing on price and transportation criteria in convention
and golf and spa category}
\end{figure}


\item Second example is selecting the comfortable and attractiveness criteria
in museum and monument category. Here is the testing result from comfortable
and attractiveness criteria in museum and monument category that can
be seen on the figure 4.16 below. 


\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{scenario2b}

\protect\caption{Scenario testing on comfortable and attractiveness criteria in museum
and monument category}


\end{figure}


\end{enumerate}

The scenario testing for two criteria is also conducted for each combination
of the criteria and category with manual calculation and using the
application and obtained the corresponding results from all scenario
testing. 

\item Testing on three criterion


This testing is done by conducting selection for three criterion: 
\begin{enumerate}
\item First example is selecting the distance, price and transportation
criteria in convention and exhibition category. Here is the testing
result from distance (from Depok), price and transportation criteria
in convention and exhibition category that can be seen on the figure
4.17 below.


\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{scenario3a}

\protect\caption{Scenario testing on distance, price and transportation criteria in
shopping category}
\end{figure}


\item Second example is selecting the attractiveness, transportation and
tourist facility criteria in art and culture category. Here is the
testing result from attractiveness, transportation and tourist facility
criteria in art and culture category that can be seen on the figure
4.18 below.


\begin{figure}[H]
\includegraphics[scale=0.4]{scenario3b}

\protect\caption{Scenario testing on attractiveness, transportation and tourist facility
criteria in art and culture category}


\end{figure}


\end{enumerate}

The scenario testing for three criteria is also conducted for each
combination of the criteria and category with manual calculation and
using the application and obtained the corresponding results from
all scenario testing. 

\end{enumerate}

\subsection{Functionality Testing }

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}\foreignlanguage{american}{The functionality testing
is done to test all the functions that exist in this website application.
The functionality testing can be seen in table 4.1.}

\subsection{User Acceptance Testing}

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}\foreignlanguage{american}{To determine whether the
application is feasible or not to use, user acceptance testing is
done by conducting surveys. It is done to determine the extent to
which this application works properly and benefit to the user. User
acceptance testing is done with give questionnaire to get analysis
data. The test involves 20 users in general to use and test this application,
the test conducted offline using the researcher's computer in general
irrespective to the age and gender. }

\selectlanguage{american}%
Final score from questionnaire result obtained from the sum of average
score of each test result. Final assessment is measured by the range
that has been determined to get conclusions from the result of assessment.
Table 4.3 below is the data collected from a questionnaire that was
distributed in the field. Table 4.4 describes the overall results
of the questionnaire. Based on the questionnaire data table 4.2, the
statement will be grouped again by the display, functionality, and
the ease of operation. The use of four scale in this questionnaire
due to in assessing the user acceptance test in this application does
not need the specific assessment because this application is intended
for public and not intends to examine a specific case. Grouping questionnaire
data will be described in Table 4.4.

The final score from the questionnaire that has been collected is
found by adding the average (mean) ratings for each test. Of that
amount then the level of application users\textquoteright{} satisfaction
can be distinguished. The final assessment is then measured with a
predetermined range to draw conclusions from the results. 

Satisfaction level: 

3.1 - 4.0 = Very Agree 

2.1 - 3.0 = Agree 

1.1 - 2.0 = Do not Agree 

0.1 - 1.0 = Very Don\textquoteright t Agree 

\begin{equation}
MeanAspek(MA)=\frac{\sum ScoringMean}{\sum Respondent}
\end{equation}


$MA=\frac{3.2+3.1+2.9+3.5+2.8+2.9+2.9+2.9+2.9+3.0+3.6+3.1+3.7+3.2+3.1+2.9+3.0+3.0+2.9+3.0}{20}=\frac{61.6}{20}=3.08$

The final calculation of the Likert scale in figure 4.3 shows the
average total score at 3.08 from 20 application users. This result
proves that from the tests conducted, the averages of respondents
agree with the website application of decision support system in choosing
DKI Jakarta tourist destination. 

\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{overall}

\protect\caption{Overall Likert Scale}


\end{figure}


Figure 4.6 shows the calculation results of the Likert scale for display
category. The average total score generated from classification questionnaire
for display category is: 

$MA=\frac{9.2}{3}=3.06$

\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{display}

\protect\caption{Display Category Likert Scale}


\end{figure}


Respondents expressed agree with the display that given in the website
application of decision support system in choosing DKI Jakarta tourist
destination is interesting. 

Figure 4.6 also shows the calculation results of the Likert scale
for functionality category. The average total score generated from
classification questionnaire for functionality category is: 

$MA=\frac{12.35}{4}=3.08$

\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{overall}

\protect\caption{Functionality Category Likert Scale}


\end{figure}


Respondents agree with the functionality given in the website application
of decision support system in choosing DKI Jakarta tourist destination
is useful. 

Figure 4.6 shows the calculation results of the Likert scale for ease
of operation category too. The average total score generated from
classification questionnaire for ease of operation category is: 

$MA=\frac{9.15}{3}=3.05$

\begin{figure}[H]
\centering\includegraphics[scale=0.6]{ease}

\protect\caption{Ease of Operation Likert Scale}


\end{figure}


Respondents expressed agree that the website application of decision
support system in choosing DKI Jakarta tourist destination is easy
to use.

\selectlanguage{english}%

\chapter{CONCLUSIONS AND FUTURE WORKS}


\section{Conclusions}

\hspace{1.5em}From the results of application testing that has been
done, it may take several conclusions as follows: 
\begin{enumerate}
\item The process of making the Web Based Application of Decision Support
System in Choosing DKI Jakarta Tourist Destinations With AHP Method
has successfully developed and registered with domain name www.jkt4fun.zz.vc
which is the selection is divided by categories and criterion. The
categories are recreation, entertainment, golf and spa, shopping,
exhibition and convention, art and culture, theater and concerts,
culinary, kepulauan seribu and museum and landmarks. The criterion
are distance, price, acttractiveness, tourism facility, public facility,
transportation, comfort, security, remembrance and others.
\item Users or tourist can make a selection based on one category of tourist
destinations and can choose more than one criteria given in this application
so that the results obtained are multiple criteria.
\selectlanguage{american}%
\item Based on the results of the discussion that has been done, the system
can run well and this application can be one solution for the tourist
that visiting DKI Jakarta in helping to determine the existing tourist
destinations in Jakarta. Overall likert scale score shows the average
total score at 3.08 from 20 application users. From the likert scale
result proves that the website application of decision support system
in choosing DKI Jakarta tourist destination is interesting in application
display, the application functionality is useful and the application
is easy to use. 
\end{enumerate}
\selectlanguage{american}%

\section{Future Works }

\selectlanguage{english}%
\hspace{1.5em}Advice that can be given to the development of this
system in the future are follows: 
\begin{enumerate}
\item The application could choose with multiple categories and criterion
and doing the calculation between those mixed combinations.
\item This application is expected have the price and distance range feature
that could help the tourist in determining tourist destination in
DKI Jakarta based on their desirable price and distance range. 
\item Then, the application is expected to have a more attractive and more
interactive interface design so that the tourist can use the application
easily and the information for each category is expected to be divided
into each category information to give the different detail information
based on each category. 
\item This application is expected to be developed using a direct survey
to the tourist to survey every tourist destination's criterion in
each tourist destination site or with live scoring feature in this
application, so that the criterion value that exist in this application
is reliable and appropriate to the actual circumstances and obtained
the closer truth value. 
\end{enumerate}
\selectlanguage{american}%
